history.content:
How "low level" is it? OS-level, my advice is to read and re-write/read GNU's `coreutils` for UNIX. Search github and you'll find out. Use git tag to switch to the very first version, and you'll be amazed on how these genius wrote this. As for some books, CPP (C Primer Plus) is my favorite. There is a book specially for C pointers written by a Japanese guy Maebashi, but I forgot what the name of the book is. Idk on hardware level/kernel level tbh, but i'm pretty jealous (can't find no intern for me) -----

Former 61C TA here, the C unit in 61C is only 1 week (3 lectures) long. You can (fully) pick up C in the next 3 weeks. I would go over some past 61C lectures/slides/discussions/etc. and also read the K&R C book.

The thing about C is that there isn't much to know. The language itself is pretty barebones and doesn't provide a lot of facilities. If you are able to pick up the concept of pointers and the C memory model, you should be fine.

I'd also like to add that you shouldn't worry! Everything that you need to know you will learn on the job, and nobody will judge you for asking questions or being slow at first. Good luck!

children.subject: There is a quick guide to C at http://cslibrary.stanford.edu/101/EssentialC.pdf
You can easily go through K&R in 3 weeks.

history.content:
I somehow managed to clutch a SWE internship at a relatively well-known semiconductor chip company. Problem is, my manager told me this is "going to be a primarily low-level software development position."   

I'm assuming this means C is gonna be utilized a lot, and sadly I haven't taken 61C yet.  Obviously I won't be able to pick up all of the paradigms and concepts of 61C in the next 3 weeks, however I think learning C would put me in a much better place than where I'm currently at. 

Any one have any tips or resources to learn C quickly? Any tips or advice in general? I'm a sophomore and this will be my very first internship. I'm downright terrified if I'm being honest. How screwed am I?
history.subject: Best way to practically learn C quick? Scared for my internship.
